activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassini Cherrell Hill Jr.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 11, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:17 AM Defendant Cassini Cherrell Hill in court by video with attorney Robert C Howard by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Kristian Zimmerman of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Officer Zachary Stec of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity:Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:39 PM Defendant Cassini Cherrell Hill in court by video with attorney Robert C Howard in person.  David S Olson  and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Robert Howard
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court finds good cause to waive time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Matter continued for decision on preliminary hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on May 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:35 AM Defendant Cassini Cherrell Hill in court by audio.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Zimmerman and Officer Stec appeared by video. Defendant does not have Counsel. Remand to Branch 7.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:02 PM Defendant Cassini Cherrell Hill in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David Zarwell and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders $500 Cash Bond with conditions: No contact with Co Defendant E.L.B. No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.I.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Must remain in residence between the hours of 6pm and 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. No acts or threats of violence. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 9:30 AM.

No contact directly or indirectly with co-defendant E.L.B. and  victim K.I.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Curfew from 6pm to 6am unless traveling to and from work. No act of threats or violence.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
